Large whumpf with widespread shooting crack across the entire slope. The slope was on average 34 degrees but did not avalanche. Below treeline open slope. Pit was dug about 10 feet above where the whumpf was triggered. No snowpack tests were conducted as the layer of failure was easily identified as just below the buried surface hoar on the well-developed facets.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: In other pits the old snow "layer cake" of facets and crust ranges from 6" to 12". ECTP scores on the upper most layer of facets were more often in the low teens. HS was generally about 100-110 cm.

Variable winds below treeline; unable to visually observe blowing snow but audible winds @ treeline and above. Snowpack observed to a depth of 110cm, several insignificant shears within storm snow (~30cms), which uniformly gains hardness with depth. No snowpack temperature obs, no ECTs completed.

Early season profile. The winter started with good snow at the beginning of December, then windy time, which created windloading; The worrying is the top layer, which has faceted crystal and may become weak layer if a slab is formed on top; Български - притеснителен е най-горния слой, който е с дребни захаристи кристали (фасети) и може да е слаб слой при навяване на дъска над него!

Location.name: Simpson Study Full

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized; Cracking;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
Avy 12/19/21 - west side of ghost ridge - recent storm overnight - around 32 degrees, fluffy tree bombs all day, more later - wet - snowing lightly - 90cm depth total to ground 4869 alt West facing slopes testes and ridden All fist dense except two thin crust 30cm deep or 50 cm from bottom
Wet slough / storm slab activity - appeared to be at rain crust - easily set off while making turns riding down. Set of slough the length of the ski and wide propagations 10-20ft across creating crown and debris field. No major slides set off while skinning back up 25-40 degree angle to get out of the avy hazard zone.
No coverage issues

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Collapsing, widespread; Cracking; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; Snowmobile tracks on slope;
Collapsing, localized; Poor pit location;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Skied wolf creek pass last week and dug a pit while we were out there. In the shady portions of the meadow off the pass, we experienced two large whumps. Prior to leaving we dug a pit, since it was dark our pit location was non-ideal for the ECT. While clearing out the sides of the walls for the test, we experience a failure, however it started in the new snow layer at 80 cm, then shot back over the weak faceted layer at 55 cm (in a triangle form, see photo). So not a true ECTPV. We went ahead with the test and had failures in the new snow layer until ECTN23 at the faceted layer, but only saw failure under the shovel area. I attribute this unclear ECT to the poor area we performed the test, however, the propagation seen during isolation was unsettling.

Pit_Observation.activities: We snowmobiled slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Deep fresh snow with little or no base in most places.. Northerly facing terrain above about 8000' holds shallow old snow (Oct. and Nov.) in some areas plagued by facets above and below a rime crust.
Pit dug on NE aspect of Blueberry Knoll.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Maa kivirakkaa.

After a dry and mild fall, Montana and Idaho entered winter, receiving 70-100cms (2-3 feet) of snow in the past 5 days in the Lost Trail Pass area. The storm has settled well most locations, however there is a layer of concern on steeper, shaded, northerly aspects above 7500'. Test results showed propagation around a meter down in two study pits 145cm deep (ECTP22 @47cm SC/Q1; ECTP28@47cm SC/Q1). Though generally conditions are good, keep an eye on those slopes. And be aware, early season conditions still persist !
Mycket flack läsluttning. Mer kompakt flak än brantare läsluttningar i närheten.
Maa kivirakkaa. Vielä paljon kiviä paljaana, ei voi laskea. Rinteen yläosaan paikoin kerryttänyt yli metriä lunta.
BTAC/JHAG recon south of resort boundary
